column4: I haven't been following along, but if you're thinking of hd testing make sure you've tried running a smart selftest
or off a livecd. "smartctl -t long" iirc (but check the manpage) and there are gui tools as well.
the vast majority of drives support smart, and it usually does a pretty good job of testing (comparable to running drive-specific tools)
I am afraid these tools will not apply to me as the drive is an external USB (enclosure SATA)
If it had been internal, SMART would work, but as an external, it throws an error message about its not being supported
ahh. Very recent versions of smartctl have some support for smart through usb, but it may not support the one you have.
apologies, I had missed that bit of information.

Sorry to bother again. I believe that the problem with the boot latency I am having could also be related to the type of my motherboard. I have just found out that 10.04 does not auto-mount my DVD-RWs which are both PATA (IDE) on the same bus
where did you say the latency was again? can you see it in dmesg?
I haven't really been following along, just wanted to mention smartctl when drive checking came up
Not really. It comes before that. However, in dmesg you can see a couple of cannot probe smb1 errors
